sentence.Network_en: Does the UN convene every year?

sentence.Network_en: The Diet will convene at 3 p.m. tomorrow.
sentence.Network_cn: 国会将于明天下午三点钟开会.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Latin convenire 'assemble, agree, fit', from con- 'together' + venire 'come'

entry.def: If someone convenes a meeting or conference, they arrange for it to take place. You can also say that people convene or that a meeting convenes .

example.ex: Last August he convened a meeting of his closest advisers at Camp David...
example.tran: 去年8月，他召集自己最亲近的顾问在戴维营开会。

example.ex: Senior officials convened in October 1991 in London.

sentences.sentence: "The students were convened in the auditorium"

Sentence.sentence: The UN had the foresight to convene a "world assembly on ageing" back in 1982, but that came and went.

sentences.en: Does the UN convene every year?
sentences.cn: 联合国每年都召开大会吗?

sentences.en: The chairman convened the committee to put the issue to a vote.
sentences.cn: 主席召集委员们开会对这个问题进行表决。

sentences.en: I was very glad to convene them all together one afternoon at Chequers.
sentences.cn: 那天下午，我很高兴把他们召集到契克斯。

jushi.english: I don't think the meeting will convene tomorrow.
jushi.chinese: 我认为会议明天是不会召开的。

jushi.english: The next meeting will convene on coming Sunday at the same place.
jushi.chinese: 下次会议将于本星期日在同一地点举行。

jushi.english: When do you expect the Geneva conference will convene?
jushi.chinese: 你预计日内瓦会议将在何时召开?
